ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: A basic knowledge of the Italian language and friendship in classmates.
I learned how to speak italian.
Learned the basics of the Italian language as well as some culture

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: 4 days a week and one asynchronous day 
Weaknesses: asynchronous activities were sometimes unhelpful

There are short little quizzes at the beginning of most classes on the previous night's reading, which (although a bit annoying) really do help with learning the vocabulary. The tests aren't especially difficult as long as you keep up with the textbook readings. Michael is a funny dude and made sure to make the class fun and engaging every single day. My only complaint is that I wish we had gotten some more grades back so I had a better idea of where my overall grade was at heading into the final exam.
Daily assignments and memorization can be hard to manage with high workload. Asynchronous day helps
I really liked the asynchronous class on Fridays. It kept me engaged during the in-person classes.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely, and take it with Michael if you can!! He is so caring and supportive, and he makes even a 9:25 class something to look forward to everyday.
Yes! Italian requires work everyday but it is a fun environment and small class size to help with learning!

Yes. I think Italian is a great language to learn if you want to fulfill your requirements. Great department, interesting language that's easy enough to understand, not too difficult, classes were fun, and a manageable course load if you keep up with it.

Definitely. I'm not that great at learning languages and really only took the class to satisfy the language distributional requirement, but nonetheless Michael made the class enjoyable and engaging. Although the class meets four days a week, I didn't find the workload to be overwhelming or anything. Michael is a funny guy and would have the whole class laughing at least a few times during every single class. Would recommend to anyone interested in learning Italian (or to anyone just interested in a chill, fun class to satisfy the language requirement).
Yes, if you want to learn Italian this course is a great start
Absolutely, especially if you get to take it with Michael, light of my life. He truly made every 9:25 feel like a 2PM course.
